snippet.title: Meditating on Pleasure - Daniel Thorson - Sunday Sit
snippet.description:
The Buddha said that "concentration has pleasure as its prerequisite‚Äù (SN 12:23). In this Sunday Sit, we will practice cultivating a sense of well-being, ease, and pleasure in our body through playing with the breath and attention. 

By learning to access and abide in harmonious states of well-being we discover a trustworthy basis for living a life of joyful service and gradually emancipate ourselves from dependency on the sense pleasures provided by our economic system. This joy and relinquishment is the soil from which transformative insight emerges.

-----

The Monastic Academy is a training center dedicated to creating wise, powerful, and loving leaders who are an unstoppable force for social and environmental peace on Earth. www.monasticacademy.com

We are accepting applications for 2-3 month-long apprenticeships. The training will provide you opportunities to dive deeply into mindfulness practice in community, working, and dedicated sitting periods. The apprenticeship is FREE with room and board provided.
Learn more here: www.monasticacademy.com/apprentice
